big.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: of more than average size or amount
big.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: She had a big grin on her face.
Los Angeles is the biggest city in California.
The garage isn’t big enough for two cars.
When they lose, they lose in a big way (=to a large degree).
There was this great big (=extremely big) spider in the sink.
big.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: Buying your own house is a big commitment.
The big game is on Friday.
There’s a big difference between understanding something and being able to explain it to others.
Everyone was getting ready for the big day (=a day when an important event will happen).
big.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: successful or popular, especially in business or entertainment
big.translation[0].definitions[2].note.t: the big boys (=the most powerful people or companies)
big.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: Julia Roberts became a big star.
After years as a small-time actor, he suddenly made it big (=became very successful) in Hollywood.
big.translation[0].definitions[4].defini: older or more like an adult – used especially by children or when you are talking to children
big.translation[0].definitions[4].exampl: Come on, don’t cry. You’re a big girl now.
big.translation[0].definitions[5].defini: doing something to a large degree
big.translation[0].definitions[5].note.t: be a big fan/admirer of somebody/something
big.translation[0].definitions[5].exampl: Des is a big gambler, you know.
big.translation[0].definitions[6].defini: done to a large degree or with great energy
big.translation[0].definitions[6].note.t: give somebody a big hand (=hit your hands together with enthusiasm, to show you have enjoyed a performance)
big.translation[0].definitions[6].exampl: Mama gave me a big hug.
big.translation[0].definitions[7].defini: used to emphasize how bad something is
big.translation[0].definitions[7].exampl: AIDS remains a big problem in many parts of the world.
Buying that house was a big mistake.
I never said that, you big liar!
big.translation[0].definitions[8].defini: big letters are capitals, for example G, R, A etc
big.translation[0].definitions[9].defini: big words are long or unusual and are difficult to read or understand
The title was in big black letters
The title was in black big letters
